description: Old French broez, brouez, brouets plural of broet, brouet (French brouet ‘gruel’), from breu, from *brodittum, a diminutive of vulgar Latin *brodum, from Germanic *brod ‘sauce’ (English broth).

entries.meaning: (obsolete or dialectal) a kind of broth thickened with bread or meal
examples: […]  an hundred dishes of poultry besides other birds and brewises, fritters and cooling marinades.
